alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central McCurtain County through 345 PM CDT... At 330 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles south of Whitesboro, or 24 miles east of Clayton, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Battiest. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for southeastern Oklahoma.
